intro: Lantana lilacina var. media, commonly known as the compact lantana, is a compact shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It features dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to lavender, blooming throughout the growing season. The plant has opposite, narrow, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for coastal and tropical gardens. Its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees adds to its ecological value.
